Column Comment.0: PRODUCTION ENTITY SUBTYPE: the type of production entity may be equal to oneof the table names of the PDEN subtype tables, such as PDEN_WELL,PDEN_COUNTY or PDEN_FIELD. Validated by check constraint.
Column Comment.1: PRODUCTION ENTITY IDENTIFIER: An identifier that is unique within a specificproduction entity source and type.
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: VOLUME METHOD: The type of method used to determine the volume of flu idsmoved. Examples would be measured, prorated, engineering study, e tc.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVITY TYPE: The type of activity that caused the movement of fluid s to occursuch as production, injection, flaring, sales, etc.
Column Comment.5: PERIOD TYPE: A reference table identifying the length of time for which a volume isrecorded. Possible values are DAY, MONTH, YEAR.
Column Comment.6: PDEN_PERIOD_ID: Unique identifier for the production period.
Column Comment.7: AMENDMENT SEQUENCE NUMBER: used to order amendment events forproduction volumes. For each PDEN, volume method, acitivity type, period type andvolume date, the first row is 0. Subsequent rows are sequenced by 1, so that the fullamendment history may be recreated. When supporting amendments, rows areusually not editable once entered. Instead, new rows are created that track theamended record.
Column Comment.8: PRODUCT_TYPE: The product identified as a component for this table.
Column Comment.9: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.10: CUMULATIVE VOLUME: Value for the cumulative volume of fluid reported. This isusually captured as the closing volume for the period (not normally the openingvolume)
Column Comment.11: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.12: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.13: GAS ENERGY: The amount of gas energy produced.
Column Comment.14: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE for this row of data
Column Comment.15: MASS:The mass of the product measured, used in some areas instead of volumes
Column Comment.16: ORIGINAL UNIT OF MEASURE for this row of data
Column Comment.17: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.18: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.19: REPORT IND: A Y/N flag added to allow users to keep track of rows that should beincluded in reporting.
Column Comment.20: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.21: VOLUME: A volume of fluid that had moved between two points.
Column Comment.22: VOLUME DATE: The effective or reporting date of this volume summary.
Column Comment.23: DATE FORMAT DESCRIPTION: Use this column to define the level of precision inthe DATE format colums, such as YYYY, or YYYQQ, or YYYYMM or YYYYMMDD
Column Comment.24: VOLUME OUOM: Volume original unit of measure.
Column Comment.25: VOLUME QUALITY: Value for the thermal quality of the fluid reported. This is oftenrecorded in British Thermal Units (BTUs) and can be used to calculate the Barrel ofOil Equivalent (BOE).
Column Comment.26: VOLUME QUALITY OUOM: Volume quality original unit of measure.
Column Comment.28: YEAR TO DATE VOLUME: Value of the cumulative reported volume for the currentyear.
Column Comment.29: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.30: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.31: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.32: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.33: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.34: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.35: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
